page.title: 10New Silksworth (cont)
page.content: The majority of working men have to travel outside of{Silksworth}in order to find work. There are good bus services into{Sunderland}and the surounding districts. About 60% of familes in{New Silksworth}own a car. New buildings in the village include a{health centre}and a{private housing {estate}near the{cricket field. At the present time a new{junior {school}is being built to replace the present buildings which are 110 years old. it is interesting to compare the cost of the new school, which will accommodate 350 children, with the {miners' hall}in{Blind Lane}which was built in 1893 for public entertainment and could hold 900 people. In 1893 the {miners' hall}cost Â£3, 300. in 1985 the cost of the new school is estimated at almost Â£1,000,000.
